title: Facebook's stock hits record high, signaling recovery after extended historic slump
text: Shares of Facebook, which have been doggedly crawling their way back from a historic slump after lapses in users' privacy sparked fears of lower profits, on Friday struck an intra-day record high for the first time in over a year.

title: If you thought Zuckerberg would ever rein in rightwing demagogues, think again
text: Mark Zuckerberg’s new year’s resolutions show Facebook has no plans to change its ways. At least the lip service is over

title: Facebook, Tesla and Netflix comebacks show how investors can overreact to headlines and miss out
text: Headlines don't always tell the whole story, and investors who sold Facebook, Tesla or Netflix on negative news developments missed out.

title: Facebook's stock hits all-time high after BofA analyst gets more bullish
text: Shares of Facebook Inc. FB, +0.43% edged up 0.4% in morning trading Friday, and reached a record high in intraday trading, after BofA Securites analyst Justin Post said he was now a little more bullish on the social media company, citing expected "green shoots" monetization initiatives and managed expenses.

title: What Libra's 2020 Launch Might Mean For Cryptocurrency
text: This assumption is further supported by the array of crypto-related events that are expected to take place throughout the year.

title: Facebook's stock performance reflects the fundamentals of the business: Expert
text: Facebook stock was up 66% since the beginning of 2019 despite being part of a Department of Justice antitrust probe, paying a $5 billion FTC fine and a heated hearing with CEO Mark Zuckerberg on Capitol Hill. Victor Anthony, managing director for internet at Aegis Capital, and Mark Zgutowicz, senior analyst covering technology at Rosenblatt Securities, join "Squawk Box" to discuss.

title: Facebook critics torch its do-nothing stance on false political advertising
text: Facebook will soon let users limit their exposure to political ads but made no changes to microtargeting or fact-checking of those ads.

title: Facebook Refuses To Limit Political Ads But Gives Users More Control Over Them
text: Facebook, Inc. (NASDAQ: FB) is sticking to its policy of allowing all political ads to appear on its platform, without any fact-checking, according to Reuters.
